source_sentence: 不空羂索神變真言經卷第二十
translation: Bukong juansuo shenchang zhenyan jing, vol. 20
six

source_sentence: 大唐天竺三藏菩提流志譯
translation: Bodhiruci Transliteration of the Tripiṭaka of the Great Tang Dynasty

source_sentence: 大可畏明王品第五十八
translation: 58th Chapter of the Great and Fearless King of Illumination

source_sentence: 爾時觀世音菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: It was then that the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Avalokitêśvara replied to Venerable Bhagavān.
Again, he said to Venerable Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 此不空羂索心王陀羅尼真言廣大解脫蓮華曼拏羅印三昧耶中。
translation: "In this samaya of the dhāraṇī of the nonempty lasso mind king, the maṇḍala seal of the vast liberated lotus, is this true teaching.

source_sentence: 不空大可畏明王央俱捨真言大曼拏羅印三昧耶。
translation: It's a great maṇḍala-mudrā of the nonempty, great fearsome, and insightful dhāraṇī king, the central kuśa, and the great maṇḍala-mudrā.
It's a true language that can be practiced with all people.

source_sentence: 大可畏明王央俱捨真言最勝法句。
translation: It's the most excellent phrase of the true words of the great fearsome luminous king Yogâcāra.

source_sentence: 能證一切旖暮伽王諸勝願行無等等法。
translation: It's capable of realizing all of King Kammuṅga's excellent vows and practices, as well as peerless dharmas.

source_sentence: 能摧一切諸惡天龍藥叉羅剎乾闥婆阿素洛蘖嚕茶緊那囉摩呼羅伽人非人等。
translation: It can destroy all the evil gods, dragons, yakṣas, rājas, gandharvas, asuras, rūḍas, kiṃnaras, mahoragas, humans, and nonhumans.
They all submit to and honor this teaching.

source_sentence: 能摧一切諸惡毘那夜迦欲界魔王。
translation: He's able to destroy all the evil demon kings of the desire realm of Vaiñāyaka.
All of his retinues vow to subdue and protect him.
They're capable of destroying all enemies and evil people.

source_sentence: 治罰禁繫種種調弄起大信見。
translation: He punishes, restrains, and disciplines them in various ways, generating great faith and insight.

source_sentence: 今欲佛前演示此大可畏明王央俱捨真言。
translation: Now, I'd like to demonstrate this great fearsome, luminous king central kuśa true saying before the Buddha.

source_sentence: 當為發護一切曼拏羅印三昧耶。
translation: It's a samaya that gives rise to the seal of the maṇḍala that protects all.

source_sentence: 以大可畏明王央俱捨真言大威德力。
translation: Because of the great authoritative power of the true words of Mahātejas garuḍêndra, he'll be able to treat and punish all places and all prohibitions with great faith and vision.

source_sentence: 於一切處若治若罰一切諸惡妬裔鬼神。
translation: In all places, it's a way to treat and punish all the evil destructive spirits and ghosts.
He causes them to guard them all.

source_sentence: 向茲廣大解脫蓮華曼拏羅印三昧耶住。
translation: He abides in the samaya of the seal of the vast liberating lotus maṇḍala.
He causes them to respect, honor, and guard it.

source_sentence: 崇仰是法助持諸佛速疾成就。
translation: Venerate this teaching as an aid in the speedy accomplishment of the buddhas.

source_sentence: 惟願世尊以大神力垂哀如被。
translation: May the Bhagavān grant him great supernatural powers to compassionately accept him as he is.

source_sentence: 廣為利益一切有情修善法者。
translation: Extensively benefit all sentient beings who cultivate good qualities.
They'll attain superior well-being.
It was then that the Śākyamuni Tathāgata came.

source_sentence: 謂觀世音菩薩摩訶薩曰。
translation: He told Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva Mahāsattva.
"Good, good, good man!
I've empowered and sealed your teaching.

source_sentence: 過現所有一切如來應正等覺。
translation: All tathāgatas, Arhats, and Fully Awakened Ones in the past and present have been enlightened and sealed with your dharma teachings.
They've also been enlightened and sealed with your dharma teachings.

source_sentence: 一切執金剛菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: All the vajra-holding bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas.

source_sentence: 執金剛祕密主菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: The Bodhisattva Mahāsattva who holds the Vajra's secret lordship.
They've also used their supernormal powers to bless and seal your approach.

source_sentence: 加被汝斯大可畏明王央俱捨真言三昧章句。
translation: He has bestowed upon you this great and fearsome luminous king, the central kuśa true speech samādhi phrase.

source_sentence: 一切天龍藥叉羅剎乾闥婆阿素洛蘖嚕茶緊那羅摩呼羅伽。
translation: All the gods, dragons, yakṣas, rājas, gandharvas, asuras, tamarindas, kiṃnaras, and mahoragas [are] delighted, honored, and thirsty for this teaching.
They are delighted, respectful, and venerable, and they crave this teaching.
You will expound it and make it widely beneficial.
Now, all those who cultivate goodness.

source_sentence: 證成最勝無等等法悉地成就。
translation: They'll realize the accomplishment of the most excellent and peerless dharma.'

source_sentence: 爾時觀世音菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: It was then that Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva Mahāsattva
He took the Buddha's obeisance and looked up to the Tathāgata.
He rejoiced and smiled.
He was in the presence of the Bhagavān and truly observed the multitude.
They were terrified by their awe-inspiring superknowledge and impressive appearance.

source_sentence: 放大火光顰眉奮目狗牙上出振吼不空大可畏明王央俱捨真言曰。
translation: Magnifying his flaming brows, he drew his eyebrows up and flashed his eyes, and his dog's teeth rose up and roared, "Amoghasiddhi, the great fearsome king of lights," he said in the verbal language.

At the time he spoke this true teaching.

source_sentence: 三千大千世界蘇彌山王。
translation: "There are a trichiliocosm of great one-thousand worlds, Sumeru the king of mountains.
All the celestial palaces, sun palaces, moon palaces, and star palaces, dragon palaces, and all the palaces of the gods.
The star palaces, dragon palaces, and all the gods' palaces.
Six great earthquakes shook them.
All the springs, rivers, and seas.
All at once, a fire arises and waves swell up.
All the evil yakṣas and yakṣas.

source_sentence: 天龍藥叉羅剎乾闥婆阿素洛蘗嚕荼緊那羅摩呼羅伽。
translation: The gods, dragons, yakṣas, lāzas, gandharvas, asuras, lhūrṇas, kiṃnaras, and mahoragas.
The demon Vaiśācī, the demon Vaiñāyaka, and the demon Tārāha.
He's a tulakha demon.
They're all overcome by fever and depression, and they're crippled to the ground.
All the powerful yakṣas and rājasas.

source_sentence: 諸天神鬼奪人精氣食噉之者。
translation: Those gods, spirits, and ghosts snatch human energy and feed on it.
They are all set on fire and shout loudly, "Suffer!
"Oh, suffering! Oh, suffering! They're paralyzed to the ground!
They may then run away, their bodies blazing.

source_sentence: 四天王天大自在天三十三天。
translation: The four heavenly kings and gods, the Trāyastriṃśa gods, and the Śakra gods are all on fire.
Indra, the Śakra, and Brahma Heavens.
The Heaven of the Attendants of Brahmā, the Heaven of the Brahma-heaven, and the Heaven of the Brahma-heaven.

source_sentence: 一切諸天眷屬宮殿一時火起。
translation: All of the gods' retinues and palaces burst into flames at once.
Their hair on their heads was standing on end, and they were terrified.
The dragon king Nandanavana, the dragon king Planeta, and the dragon king Bhadanta rose up in flames.

source_sentence: 優波難陀龍王娑伽羅龍王。
translation: Upananda the Dragon King and Sāgara the Dragon King.
And there were measureless hundreds of thousands of dragon kings.
All their retinues and their palaces.
At one point, a fire started, and they were terrified.
All living creatures on land and water were terrified.
They're all terrified as the fire rages and heats up.

source_sentence: 在斯會者身戰毛竪悚懼不安。
translation: Those present at this meeting have their hair standing on end, and they're frightened and agitated.

source_sentence: 可補陀落山於虛空中如來頂上雨列諸天種種寶華眾寶瓔珞天諸衣服。
translation: On Mount Kebudhara, on top of the Tathāgata's head in the sky, it rains down a multitude of heavenly treasures and flowers, jewels and jewelry, and celestial garments.

source_sentence: 繽紛亂墜光潔奇特現眾神變。
translation: They are resplendent and disheveled, brilliant and marvelous, and they display many miraculous powers.

source_sentence: 雨於諸天牛頭栴檀香水。
translation: It rains down cow-headed, sandalwood-scented water from the gods.
It scatters the fragrant odor and smoke of the great multitude.
They made a wide array of offerings to the Buddha, the assembly, and everyone in it.

source_sentence: 爾時執金剛祕密主菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: It was then that the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva, who holds the Vajra Veil, the Secret Lord, rose from his seat and turned his posture, looked at him instantly, and saw him.
He rose from his seat, rotated his posture, and looked at them instantly.

source_sentence: 諦觀一切輪擲舞杵放大光明。
translation: He truly observed all the wheel-tossing, pounder-dancing buddhas radiating brightly.
It was like the lion king's majesty and virtue were immeasurable.

source_sentence: 詣觀世音菩薩摩訶薩前。
translation: He went to Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva Mahāsattva.
He joins his palms, respects his head and body, and pays homage.
He untied his jeweled crown and held it up, saying.
"Great compassionate one, may you have compassion on him.

source_sentence: 納受此大清淨月光寶華天冠常護顯此不空大可畏明王央俱捨真言章句三昧耶。
translation: Please accept this great pure jeweled crown of moon-light and flowers, which is always protected by the gods, and display this nonempty, great fearsome crown, which is the true words, phrases, and sentences of the central king of kuśa.
Its authority is limitless.

source_sentence: 令此三千大千世界六大震動。
translation: It causes the six elements of this 3,000 great one-thousand worlds to shake.

source_sentence: 擊罰一切諸惡天龍八部藥叉羅剎。
translation: They punish all the evil gods, dragons, the eight animals, yakṣas, and rāṣasas.
All kinds of demons and gods have their palaces on fire.
They're all engulfed in flames, dazed, and confused.
They shout and cry out, saying.
"Oh, suffering! Oh, suffering! There's no path to life!

source_sentence: 白言聖者我最尊此不空大可畏明王央俱捨真言。
translation: He says, "Sage, I most honored this Amoghasiddhi, the great fearsome king of gods, and the true words of Yogâcāra.
I vow to hold it in high regard for sentient beings and accept it.
I'll respectfully make offerings to them and expound it at length.

source_sentence: 若有苾芻苾芻尼族姓男族姓女。
translation: If there are any monks or nuns, clansmen or clanswomen, or clanswomen.
They write it down according to the teaching with pure faith and understanding.
They memorize, recite, hear, maintain, and cultivate it.

source_sentence: 我常擁護頂戴恭敬擔負是人。
translation: I will always protect, adorn, respect, and bear that person's burdens.

source_sentence: 若求眾願諸大悉地我為滿足。
translation: If I were to pursue many vows, I'd fulfill them in great measure.

source_sentence: 一切毘那夜迦諸惡鬼神作障難者。
translation: All the bad spirits and ghosts of the Vairocana school will cause obstruction.
I will always stop them and prevent them from being troublesome.

source_sentence: 復為此人夢覺現身而恒擁護。
translation: Also, I'll always protect this person's dream-aware present body.
His or her assets and possessions will never be scarce.
He'll attain authoritative qualities, limitless merit, and incalculable wisdom.
Without enmity, he'll find it difficult to honor the mind of the Dharma.
He takes pity on and nurtures his true self as his son.

source_sentence: 爾時觀世音菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: It was then that Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva Mahāsattva addressed the Vajra Secret Master Bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 告執金剛祕密主菩薩摩訶薩言。
translation: He told the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva, who holds the Vajra Veil, the Lord of Secrets, "Good, good!
"Good, good!
This is the greatest vow of anyone who gives rise to it.
I will accept this jeweled crown for a good person.
After extending his hand to accept it, he tossed the jeweled crown into the air.
He then tossed the jeweled crown into the air.

source_sentence: 為令一切諸佛菩薩得受用故。
translation: That's so that all the buddhas and bodhisattvas can have access to it.

source_sentence: 為令一切諸大天神住曼拏攞者得受用故。
translation: It's for the sake of all the great celestials who reside in Mannala that they might have use of it.
It's for the sake of all those who gather and cultivate goodness.

source_sentence: 天龍藥叉羅剎乾闥婆阿素洛蘖嚕茶緊那羅摩呼囉伽人非人等。
translation: The gods, dragons, yakṣas, rājas, gandharvas, asuras, troglodytes, kiṃnaras, mahoragas, humans, nonhumans, and so forth.

source_sentence: 修此不空羂索心王陀羅尼真言廣大解脫蓮華曼拏羅印三昧耶者得受用故擲寶冠時。
translation: When he cultivates this Amoghapāśa Dhāraṇī of the Heart King, the vast liberating lotus maṇḍala seal samaya, he attains its benefit when he tosses the jeweled crown.

source_sentence: 此三千大千世界六大震動。
translation: Six great shakes occur in this world of 3,000 great one-thousand worlds.

source_sentence: 一切諸惡天龍八部種種鬼神。
translation: All the evil gods, dragons, the eight animals, and various spirits rise up.
All the palaces and halls then burst into flames.
All of these evil beings are burned, drowned, and tossed to the ground.

source_sentence: 為火燒惱悶絕躄地或怖馳走叫呼大喚。
translation: They're tormented by the fire, drowning, paralyzed, or running in fear, screaming, and shouting.
They all cry out, saying, "Oh, this is painful!
'Today, there's no way for us to be born.'

source_sentence: 是時寶冠當佛頂上住虛空中。
translation: The jeweled crown then sits on top of the Buddha's head in the sky.
It became a variety of jeweled-flower umbrellas.
That canopy was made entirely of many treasures.
It's adorned in various ways, and its many colors are brilliant.
It shone brilliantly and showed numerous miraculous powers.

source_sentence: 以執金剛祕密主菩薩摩訶薩神通威力。
translation: It's based on the superknowledge and authority of the bodhisattva Mahāsattva, who holds the vajra, the secret lord, and the great fearless luminous king.

source_sentence: 以不空大可畏明王央俱捨真言神通威力。
translation: With the miraculous power of the true words of the Amoghapāśa, the great fearsome luminous king of the Ganges, and the central kuśa, he demonstrates his miraculous powers.

source_sentence: 十方一切剎土一一諸佛菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: Each of the buddhas, bodhisattvas, and mahāsattvas of all the buddha-lands in the ten directions.

source_sentence: 頂上各見有此眾寶傘蓋。
translation: Each is seen to have this umbrella of treasures on top of their heads.
It's there for all the bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas in the assembly.

source_sentence: 一切觀世音種族菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: All the bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas of the Avalokitêśvara race.

source_sentence: 亦於頂上各見有是眾寶傘蓋。
translation: On the top of their heads, they each see these umbrellas of many treasures.
On each of the four sides of the umbrellas, there were measureless flaming mirage king waters.

source_sentence: 是真言者或為毒中亦不傷害。
translation: Even if this true talker were poisoned, it wouldn't harm him.

source_sentence: 若婆修吉龍王毒德叉迦龍王毒諸蟲蛇毒亦不能害。
translation: If it's the poison of Baxiji, the dragon king, the poison of Takṣaka, or the poison of insects and snakes, it won't harm him.

source_sentence: 刀杖水火一切虎狼野象怨賊亦不相害。
translation: Knives, staves, water, and fire, and all tigers, wolves, wild elephants, and thieves won't harm each other.

source_sentence: 又復不為一切步多鬼藥叉鬼毘舍遮鬼宮槃茶鬼茶枳尼鬼雷電霹靂而作嬈害。
translation: They also won't be harmed by all the stephen demons, yakṣa demons, piśācī demons, palace demons, chachānī demons, thunderbolts, and lightning.
The tantric spirits and ghosts are terrified and don't disturb each other.

source_sentence: 又常不為一切災厄枷鎖禁閉刑罰之苦。
translation: He'll never be subject to the pain of all calamities, chains, confinement, and punishment.

source_sentence: 常得一切執金剛菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: He always obtains full possession of the Vajrapāṇi Bodhisattva Mahāsattva.

source_sentence: 四天王神伊首羅天摩醯首羅天。
translation: The four heavenly kings and gods are the god Īśvara and the god Mahêśvara.

source_sentence: 大自在天大梵天帝釋天那羅延天。
translation: Mahêśvara, the Mahêśvara god; Brahmā, the Tissa god; and Nārāyaṇa, the Nārāyaṇa god.

source_sentence: 水天風天日天月天閻羅大王。
translation: The Water-god, Wind-god, Sun-god, Moon-god, and Yama-rāja-rāja.

source_sentence: 一切龍王藥叉羅剎乾闥婆阿素洛蘖魯荼緊那羅摩呼羅伽等。
translation: All the dragon kings, the yakṣas, the rājas, the gandharvas, the asuras, the tillas, the rudras, the kiṃnaras, the mahoragas, and so forth.
They are embraced day and night, joyfully admonishing and guiding him.
They remove the many obstacles and difficulties, and they joyfully follow their guidance.

source_sentence: 然頂香王成就品第五十九
translation: Chapter 59 of the Rangding Xiangwang zhuangyangsheng pin

source_sentence: 復誥執金剛祕密主菩薩摩訶薩言。
translation: "Again, let's commend the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva, who holds the Vajra Veil, to the Lord of Secrets, saying.

source_sentence: 此大可畏明王央俱捨真言然頂香王三昧耶。
translation: "This is the great fearsome, luminous king, the central kuśa, the true saying, 'King of Incense from the Randian Vulture.'
It accomplishes all the samādhis in the world.'
He spoke the verse, saying.

source_sentence: 黑沈水香安悉香　　乾陀羅婆香甲香　數各一百八分香　　嚩(無可反)攞迦(斤邏反)香白膠香　　　蓮華鬚蘂酥合香　茅香藿香苓蔆香　　丁香數八各五分　新欝金香量八分　　麝香龍腦各四分　小柏橿黃形愚藥　　青木雄黃白芥子　安怛禰陀摩度羅　　白栴檀香薰陸香　如是數十各十分　　用上好者而合治　大可畏明王真言　　一時加持百八遍　煎安悉香汁為丸　　壇中加持現三相　煖烟光現便陰乾是香燒時三千大千世界一切山神江河海神。
translation: "When blackwater incense and sedge incense and gandharva incense and aromatic tree incense are burned, the number of each of these 108 parts of incense is combined with the best of the best and treated with the true words of the great fearsome luminous king, which are applied one hundred and eight times, and the juice of the sedge incense is boiled into a ball, which is then applied on the altar and has three appearances, and the smoke and light from it appear as a dry cloud.

source_sentence: 諸天神龍藥叉羅剎乾闥婆阿素洛蘖魯荼緊那羅摩呼羅伽。
translation: The gods, goddesses, dragons, yakṣas, lhasa, gandharvas, asuras, tulips, lhūtas, kiṃnaras, and mahoragas are all terrified.

source_sentence: 一切毘那夜迦悉皆怖畏。
translation: All of them are terrified," says Vairocana.
All the bad spirits and ghosts have their bodies broken and their skin torn asunder.
All insect venom, snake venom, and dragon venom.
When perfumed with incense, it all goes away.

source_sentence: 若有疔瘡熱腫風濕疥癬瘻病。
translation: If there are boils, sores, fever, swelling, rheumatism, scabies, and ringworm, perfuming it with incense will also remove them.
Applying incense to it also gets rid of it.

source_sentence: 若有痃癖癥塊心痛頭痛病者。
translation: If you have a disease that causes fetters, lumps, heartaches, or headaches, take this incense and water, warm, on an empty stomach, to warm it up.
Take this incense and water, mixed with warm water, on an empty stomach.

source_sentence: 或復塗熏或灌鼻中皆得除愈。
translation: It can be rubbed and perfumed again or poured into the nose, and it will all go away.
If there's rain or drought, he'll be healed.

source_sentence: 若有非時惡風雹雨雷電霹靂者。
translation: If there's an unseasonable amount of bad wind, hail, rain, thunder, and lightning, then he'll be cured.
He recites the vows, burns incense, and vows.
'It will be sunny when it's sunny and rain when it's rain.'

source_sentence: 并止一切惡風雹雨雷電霹靂。
translation: It will also stop all bad winds, hail, rain, thunder, lightning, and thunderbolts.

source_sentence: 國土人民利益安樂苗稼增盛。
translation: The people of his land will be benefited and made happy, and the crops will grow abundantly.
If he suffers from the malaria of the god Nārāyaṇa.

source_sentence: 或患一切可畏天神瘧風瘧。
translation: Or he might suffer from all the fearsome gods' malaria, wind malaria, or fever.
They may suffer from phlegm malaria, pang malaria, and cold and feverish malaria.
It comes on once every day, once every second day, and once every third day.
It comes on once every three days or once every four days.
He'll also suffer from epilepsy caused by spirits and ghosts.
They are all purified, bathed, and perfumed with incense.
The sick person will be relieved of the disease with the aid of this incense.

source_sentence: 若往聚落一切人民善不善家。
translation: Suppose he goes to a village where all the people are good and unskillful.
They wash their bodies with incense and fragrant baths, making them clean.
It also burns and perfumes his body and lights his forehead and eyes.
Then he'll go there and be seen and met by people.
They'll be delighted and happy, and their wealth and possessions will come naturally.
All calamities and monsters are removed on their own.

source_sentence: 一切大藥叉將四天王神。
translation: All the great yakṣa generals, the four heavenly kings, and the gods of the gods will look after them.
All of their retinues will observe, protect, and defend them.

source_sentence: 若諸沙門婆羅門一切人民沐浴熏身。
translation: Suppose all the ascetics, priests, and people bathe and perfume their bodies.

source_sentence: 及熏衣服或酥乳酪和施與食。
translation: They perfume their clothes, mix butter and milk and cheese, and give them food.
Or they wear them on their heads, shoulder blades, and waists.

source_sentence: 皆害一切病惱災厄速令除差。
translation: They'll be harmed by all illnesses, troubles, and calamities that will quickly be removed.

source_sentence: 是真言者亦如是佩滿眾勝願。
translation: This true chant is also worn like this to fulfill many excellent vows.

source_sentence: 此香名大可畏明王央俱捨真言然頂香王。
translation: This incense is called the great fearful luminous king, the central kiṃśa true word, and the top of the head, the king of incense.

source_sentence: 若於戌時當大門中門堂門。
translation: If you burn this incense at the eleventh hour, you'll enter the main gate, middling gate, and hall gate.

source_sentence: 燒焯此香誦是真言三遍五遍。
translation: He'll burn this incense and recite this true chant three times or five times.

source_sentence: 則逐一切牛頭獄卒大藥叉羅剎布單那鬼及諸神鬼。
translation: Then it will banish all the bullheads, jailers, great yakṣas, rāṣas, pūtanā demons, and other spirits.

source_sentence: 一時身皆為火所燒忙怖馳走。
translation: Their bodies are instantly burned by fire, and they run away in fear.
All the calamities and hindrances naturally dissipate.

source_sentence: 便得諸善天龍八部而皆擁護。
translation: They'll then be protected by the good gods, dragons, and the eight groups of gods.

source_sentence: 不空羂索神變真言經卷第二十六
translation: Bukong juansuo shenchang zhenyan jing, roll twenty-six
